channel.title: The Complete List of File Format Terms And Their Definitions on Tech Terminologies
channel.description: Recent content in The Complete List of File Format Terms And Their Definitions on Tech Terminologies

item.title: What is a Swap File?
item.description: A swap file, also known as a swap space or a paging file, is a space on a hard drive or other storage device that is used to store data temporarily when the system’s main memory (RAM) becomes full.

item.title: What is PostScript?
item.description: PostScript is a programming language and page description language used mainly in the printing and desktop publishing industries.

item.title: What is a Page Layout?
item.description: Page layout refers to the organization and formatting of elements on a page, such as text, images, and other media, in a way that is aesthetically pleasing and consistent.

item.title: What is Document Grinding?
item.description: Document grinding, also known as document shredding or document destruction, is the process of securely destroying physical documents to protect sensitive information from being accessed by unauthorized parties.

item.title: What is a Bitmap?
item.description: A bitmap is a type of digital image file that represents a grid of pixels as a collection of bits.

item.title: What is a Batch File?
item.description: A batch file is a text file that contains a series of commands that are executed by the command-line interpreter on the operating system.

item.title: What is Compression (Data Compression)?
item.description: Data compression is a technique used to represent data in a more compact form in order to reduce the amount of storage space required or to transmit the data more efficiently over a network.

item.title: What is Metadata?
item.description: The term “metadata” refers to any data that contains information about other types of data.

item.title: What is DRM (Digital Rights Management)?
item.description: Digital rights management (DRM) is a technology used to protect digital content and prevent unauthorized access, copying, or distribution.

item.title: What is a Raster File Format (Raster Images)?
item.description: A raster format is a type of digital image file that is made up of tiny pixels, or “picture elements,” arranged in a grid pattern.

item.title: What is a Vector File Format (Vector Graphics)?
item.description: Vector graphics are a type of digital image that are created using mathematical algorithms rather than pixels.

item.title: What is a Raw File Format (Raw Image Format)?
item.description: A raw image format is a file format that stores unprocessed data from a digital camera’s image sensor.

item.title: What is a Codec?
item.description: A codec is a device or software that is used to encode or decode a digital data stream or signal.

item.title: What is Encoding?
item.description: Encoding is the process of converting data from one format into another for the purpose of efficient transmission or storage.
